sentences.en: After he had all the money in the handbag, a revulsion of feeling seized him.
sentences.cn: 当他把所有的钱都装进手提包后, 他突然想变卦.

sentences.en: He felt a stab of revulsion mixed a bizarre desire to laugh.
sentences.cn: 他感到一阵恶心,同时又有一种想笑的怪怪感觉.

sentences.en: He had a revulsion against his neighbor.
He had a revulsion against his uncle, brother of his mother.
sentences.cn: 他对于他的舅父, 他母亲的哥哥,颇有反感.

sentences.en: He tried to conceal his instinctive revulsion at the idea.
sentences.cn: 他试图饰盖自己对这一想法本能的厌恶.

sentences.en: His voice was filled with horror and revulsion.
sentences.cn: 他的声音里充满了恐惧和反感。

sentences.en: Inspire fear and revulsion in all surrounding enemy units, draining their morale.
sentences.cn: 激发所有的周围敌人单位的恐惧和剧变, 排出沟外他们的士气.

sentences.en: My feeling for him undergo a revulsion when I discover his cruelty.
sentences.cn: 当我发现他的残忍时,对他的感情起了剧变.

sentences.en: My feeling toward my new friend underwent a revulsion whenIrealizedhiscrueltyand dishonesty.
sentences.cn: 当我知道他的残忍与不忠之后,我对这个新朋友的情感有一种突变.

sentences.en: News of the atrocities produced a wave of anger and revulsion.
sentences.cn: 对于暴行的报道激起了愤怒和憎恶的浪潮。

sentences.en: Reports of the plot of this unusual film tend to excite revulsion.
sentences.cn: 有关这部不同寻常电影的情节的报道常常令人生厌。

sentences.en: She felt revulsion at his appearance.
sentences.cn: 她对他的面貌感到厌恶.

sentences.en: She stared at the snake in revulsion.
sentences.cn: 她盯着那条蛇,感到很厌恶.

sentences.en: That film caused public revulsion, not least among the education circles.
sentences.cn: 该电影引起公愤, 特别是教育界的深恶.

sentences.en: That revulsion alone could have produced only indignation and sympathy for its victims.
sentences.cn: 单有那样一种厌恶只能产生愤怒和对受害者的同情.

sentences.en: There started a revulsion from Gudrun, she finished life off so thoroughly.
sentences.cn: 古娟的感情开始剧变, 她那么彻底地毁了生活.

words.tran_cn: 剧变；厌恶；强烈反感；抽回

trans.tran_cn: 剧变，抽回，厌恶，强烈的反感，[医] 诱导法
trans.tran_en: a strong feeling of shock and very strong dislike
